intro: Erigeron nauseosus, commonly known as the sickly fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant produces white to pale blue florets that bloom in summer, and its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs. It is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Erigeron nauseosus is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
